statement: The system shall provide predefined movements to assist users in regaining muscle memory.
The system shall be able to identify and differentiate various materials.
The system shall alert the user or prevent movement when it detects a material that is unsafe to approach.
The system shall be able to map out an unknown environment and identify areas within it.
The system shall display the current position of each joint within its range on the MMI screens.
The system shall change colours when the user approaches the limits.
The system shall be able to identify and differentiate various materials through visual scanning and computer vision, enabling it to determine the appropriate gripping features.
The system shall be more durable.
The system shall have minimal latency or delay when operating.
The system shall provide a variable viewpoint to allow the user to look around.
The system shall provide fixed camera views in addition to variable viewpoints.
The system shall provide an overlay on the screen as a guide.
The system shall have a no-go zone to prevent damage to surrounding objects or equipment when operating in tight environments.
The system shall produce an alarm or noise to alert the user when they are approaching a no-go zone.
The system shall have a high image resolution.
The system shall provide force feedback to indicate when the user is supposed to be moving forward and when they need to stop for further examination.
